reviews.text:
This place is one of the key iconic Dunedin attractions. It has old world charm and elegance. There is a farmers market in the car park (on either Saturday or Sunday mornings)
There are a couple of shorter tourist train journeys available from here.

The train ride was great! I loved going near the cliffs because it made me feel like I was about to fall off and break my legs, arms, neck, and spine and die immediately on impact! Very exciting time!

4/5 Stars - James P. Miller

It's a great place. Do check out this railway station. They do have some gallery thing going on on the second level, you can check those out as well. You can book for a train ride along the coast of Dunedin as well. It's something you don't get to see while driving or walking. It's recommended, the scenery is beautiful. Prices vary during summertime and winter, so do check out the prices on their website.

Fantastic trip. The sights are awesome. Thoroughly recommended. The biggest issue was choosing what side to sit on as there were numerous sights to see on both. The commentry was good, occasionally funny. One young boy told me he thought it was going to be boring but he was having a great time and I had to agree.

We took the Seasider in the morning and the Taipei Gorge train tour in the afternoon. Lovely way to see the sites along the coast and the trek through the mountains. Beautiful vistas with live commentary explaining various points of interest. Our one request would be to incorporate a system where passengers can have their questions answered. Along the way, the commentary was interesting, but we had many questions that would have been nice to have answered.
Really nice place to look around. The buildings are ornate and really nice to look at. The area by the river has a nice view of the clocktower. The facilities inside are quite nice.
Really love the building here. Feel like I'm in the Harry Potter's world. similar to the Sydney University.

They never found me a Nursing Placement on time . My visa expired so I had to go back to my country . I hardly got any compensation . When I returned to complete my Placement , my Preceptor was racist and she used to leave me alone to give medications to patients while she went out to smoke cigarettes . PATHETIC !!! One time I called my lecturer at 1700 hrs and had to write her an apology letter since they said it was not her working hours. PURE RACIST I GUESS !!!!
Beautiful part of Dunedin to stroll around

I loved my time at this school. The facilities are fantastic, the people world class and the teachers really dedicated to what they do, even in classes that sometimes have an exceptionally large catchment. 

This school gave me all the tools I needed in my undergrad to follow on to professional degrees and would definitely recommend it to anyone who is considering a New Zealand University.
Great venue for a concert. Saw The Eagles here and the seating meant no one was too far from the stage. It's covered (so you won't be cold) but you can see the sky through the ceiling (very nice!)

It's a good stadium. Probably not the best acoustics wise for seeing a great concert, more of a sporting grounds.. but in saying that, it feels like you're outside when you're not so you gotta admit that's pretty cool.
Brilliant Indoor stadium. Can still be cold if it's freezing outside but nothing like the open roofed stadiums. Minimal wind. Very clean and tidy

Brilliant Eagles Concert, sound brilliant. Very entertaining,  but reckon you should have one entrance and exit for people getting alcohol from the ground seats. As was very annoying with people walking up and down the steps in the speights stand to get alcohol. Was quite a disruptive view with them passing by for most of the night.
The Eagles in the Stadium were great. Great sound at the back stand.. No echo off walls 🖒

Didn't have much time to look around the Octagon but this was one of the buildings that you pick out from all the others. A really old and majestic looking church in the Octagon. The dual spires make it easy to find amid the other historical buildings in the area. You can also get side and rear views of the church as you walk along the outer octagon.
Love our beautiful Church, looks amazing in the centre of our Octogan in Dunedin. Architecture is incredible.

This stunning piece of architecture is a must see inside and out.. we were fortunate enough when we entered to hear the organist playing and  practising which was quit a treat, you just sit there quietly an admire the stain glass windows and all the small details that have gone into the creation of this building.
Absolutely beautiful building, great for photography. Disabled access. Atmosphere very quiet and wonderful
An impressive sight, even more impressive inside with the addition of great facilities and church services.

Old original church style Dunedin Cathedral in much need of repairs but still habitual ... worth viewing as part of your sight seeing adventure or for your church experience. Good attendance by church goers when I there.If cold wear something to keep warm as heating is limited and I would expect quiet costly ...
Not the best example visited - check out Sacred heart Timaru if you want to see a high end example

A lovely catholic church in Dunedin, and only have limited number of seats inside. Parking on the ground is also limited, though you can find on street parking in the area. If you want a bit of exercise, you can walk to here.
Very beautiful baroque cathedral.
If historical religion is your thing, this is a must see.

What a great experience going on the tour tonight. Keith is an awesome tour guide and highly knowledgeable on the past and current brewery operations. Keith was able to interact and engage with everyone so well! The history of Speights was well delivered to the audience! Enjoyed taste testing the great range of Speights products at the end of the tour and pleased to see how the group mingled. Highly recommend this tour.

Enjoyable enough, but not a "must-do".  Good quality tour guide, and well-organised, with a chance to taste all the Speight's beers at the end.  The more fascinating aspect of the tour was the information provided about the early history of Dunedin.  The actual rooms of the working part of the brewery were not particularly interesting and not explained in much detail.

Absolutely wonderful tour, a must do experience.
John was an excellent guide, knowledgeable, interesting, and funny.
Went in for a few riggers from the cellar door tonight and was pleasantly surprised to get a small discount....an effort to encourage more sales.....thanks, I'll be back.  Empire IPA recommended 😊
Excellent tour.  Delicious beer.

I love Rialto, it might be my favourite place. I love the atmosphere, the carpet, the railings on the stairs, the fact that they sell the collectable cups for marvel movies, the fact that it’s cheaper than Reading to book online, i love the way it looks, it’s beautiful, the sign outside is beautiful, and the chairs are comfortable. I’d say the only downside is the ticket cost for people over 14 years old, and sometimes the popcorn’s a bit too salty. But other than that, I love Rialto more than mostly everywhere.

I like the heritage element to this place. Last night I went to see a film festival movie in a little theatre up the back I didnt even know existed. It was cosy and amazing. The staff are always friendly and the seats are way more comfortable than the other cinema option in Dunedin
Good service. Very tidy and clean theatres. Great experience.
Kids loved the movie Ralph Breaks the Internet. Made much easier with a school holiday voucher for two small popcorn for $5. Instead of being $5.50 each. Great saving.
Great cinema, nicely refurbished - got character

This is a really beautiful place. The gardens are well thought out and done really well, creating a serene environment with beautiful rock structure, intricate buildings and calming water. There is also an area where you can listen to live music, and another where there are some small things laid out, such as calligraphy practice, Chinese checkers and a challenge of transferring marbles using chopsticks.
Went on a bit of an overcast day but still very serene.  Very photogenic place to visit.  Could also have some Chinese tea too.  Bonsai were very intricate.
Nice place to sit and be peaceful. And the little room where you can enjoy tea and a snack is cute. I enjoy going here.
beautiful example of a traditional Chinese style garden. Can only get better the more it matures - well worth a stroll.

My wife and I spent some time at the Dunedin Chinese Garden on a dull and cold November morning. The serenity of the facility was a highlight, with attractive vistas at every turn. There were some panels outlining some of the aspects of the development of the Chinese community in the area. This was interesting to us as we were unaware of these issues. The walkways are mostly undercover so do not be deterred from visiting if it is raining. Easily combined with a visit to ‘The first settlers museum’ next door.
Best place for a scenic walk. Prepare for a big walk back up. Make sure you stop and just enjoy the scenery

We discovered this spectacular work of nature, looking to fill an hour close by our hotel. This stunning beach features a deep blue to turquoise ocean, crashing waves, steep cliffs and huge rocks. Tunnels in the rocks have been worn away by the water. One of them has been stepped and leads all the way to the beach. It may be our most memorable hike ever. The hike was rated as easy. It was a steep climb down and a steep climb up on a well maintained trail.

Tunnel Beach has marvelous views! The pathway you take to the main viewing area is particularly steep, so be careful! Once you get to the viewing area, you can walk down a tunnel with stairs to access the beach.
Long walk down a very steep hill,  but I wouldn't miss it for the world. Beautiful part of God's creation. Steep walk up,  so take it easy.

Well maintained access path, well worth a visit, energetic climb on the return. Well sign posted. Caution about tides is appropriate for maximum enjoyment. (I'll pick a cooler day next time - temp was 28 degree and sunny.)

This place is one of the key iconic Dunedin attractions. It has old world charm and elegance. There is a farmers market in the car park (on either Saturday or Sunday mornings)
There are a couple of shorter tourist train journeys available from here.

The train ride was great! I loved going near the cliffs because it made me feel like I was about to fall off and break my legs, arms, neck, and spine and die immediately on impact! Very exciting time!

4/5 Stars - James P. Miller

It's a great place. Do check out this railway station. They do have some gallery thing going on on the second level, you can check those out as well. You can book for a train ride along the coast of Dunedin as well. It's something you don't get to see while driving or walking. It's recommended, the scenery is beautiful. Prices vary during summertime and winter, so do check out the prices on their website.

Fantastic trip. The sights are awesome. Thoroughly recommended. The biggest issue was choosing what side to sit on as there were numerous sights to see on both. The commentry was good, occasionally funny. One young boy told me he thought it was going to be boring but he was having a great time and I had to agree.

We took the Seasider in the morning and the Taipei Gorge train tour in the afternoon. Lovely way to see the sites along the coast and the trek through the mountains. Beautiful vistas with live commentary explaining various points of interest. Our one request would be to incorporate a system where passengers can have their questions answered. Along the way, the commentary was interesting, but we had many questions that would have been nice to have answered.

I love this place - the owner is always friendly and their food is SO cheap and yummy! Try their apple and lemon muffins, you won't be disappointed! Highly recommended for vegans, vegetarians and everyone else who loves cheap, yummy food!
My favourite restaurant in Dunedin! I go here often for the delicious, healthy food, nice atmosphere and great prices! Highly recommended.

Rude staff! My partner refused to come here because of 'incidences' in the past, but I decided to give the place a try because of their good selection of vegetarian food. 
Food arrived fast with a waiter who scowled at me when I thanked him. It tasted okay (read: not great) and the portion was disappointingly small. 
I was contemplating getting something else to satisfy the hunger pangs when a second waiter came and went to take my glass and bottle of water away. I told him I hadn't finished with it and he muttered something to the effect of "too bad, other customers" and took it. I had only been there for less than 15 minutes at this point, and left grumpy and still hungry.

Subpar: I would not recommend this to

others

Used to be quite good but have noticed the

staff aren't so positive anymore. The lady on

the till was plain rude and often has a scowl on

her face. Saying "goodbye" on our way out was

met with a blank stare and a bad vibe. Did not

feel welcome there at all.

Also, tables are often short as reserved" signs

are used, even though no diners come and take

up their reservation- seems to be a common

trend

A shell of its former glory
Their fillo rolls are the best! and their prices are reallyyyy good for organic food. definitely going back!

Food & coffee great. 
Man serving us wasn't friendly. No matter how pleasant & smiley I was in both of my interactions with him, I couldn't get him to crack a smile. 
Not very welcoming. 
Rest of the staff were great.
Amazing food and coffee. Warm venue and great service. Soup was great and ambience superb.
Great service, good food and coffee. I highly recommend this as a go to favourite.
Very nice coffee and food. Service was A+ also. Will definitely go back
Love it! What a great place. Ambiance is superb, coffee is excellent as is food.
Yummy food, excellent service, great pricing. Beautiful presentation. Nothing to fault here, love this place.

We love Jiso, it’s our regular go to place.  The food is always good.   Hopefully the new system(new owners?) is going to work in their favour...unfortunately we waited for a VERY long time (over an hour) for our food tonight which is unusual.  Also, I would suggest a better sound system.
Post script: Food arrived, delicious and drinks on the house.  All is well.

Not a fan of the new system where you can’t see a menu. You get coerced the minute you walk through the door and seated and there’s no place you can stand and read the menu. The old system was so much better, especially since you feel obliged to order something as your sat down and given water. You should want to order food not feel pushed into it.
Loved this Japanese place, very authentic. Price is very reasonable and the food is excellent.

I have eaten here for years and like the food and the waitstaff service at Jizo. Tonight, however was a shocker: 60 minutes between ordering and receiving food, people arriving after us and getting food, 3 things we ordered not available (including sashimi - at a Japanese restaurant !?). The staff didn't know what was and wasn't available and had to come back and retake our order three times.  When finally food did come it arrived 1 dish at a time. The first person had finished 15 minutes before the final dish arrived.

Reservation and greeting were perfect, and the food was wonderful. But while all 3 servers were very friendly, personable, nice, and helpful, all three were severely overworked. We were asked once if our food was OK, but for all other service, we had to get up and ask, including an intermediate request for a new plate, for our dessert menu, to order our dessert, and to get our check. The servers were going full speed all the time trying to handle the number of tables that were all in use -- the current wait staff is great, but there aren't enough of them. The manager told me they are trying to get more servers, but . . . .
Beautiful place filled with collectable items from all over the world. Food is very good and the service is top notch. Very busy so remember to book early!
Wonderful food. Good service.  Great vibe

All employees are super friendly, they take their time to make you feel welcome. The food is very high quality and tastes great. I got the chowder dish and I was in awe - tasted amazing and it was decently priced. I highly recommend going here.
Food tasted lovely and great service.  Tables can do with resurfacing as varnish is coming away. Not so hygienic.

What a great spot. Atmosphere here is really cool & laid back. The guy behind the bar was friendly, knowledgeable & very accommodating. 

Strongly recommend a stop here.

Good but I really feel the quality of dishes - particularly dessert - has slipped in comparrison to a year ago when everything was five stars. It would be nice to see more seasonal variation. The drink selection and service are always great.
Amazing selection of single malt Scotch. Great food and excellent service. Portion sizes are pretty big, just be aware of that.
Great service by a lassie with a nose ring, good haggis and smokey whiskey. What more can a McLeod ask for?

I went with a friend to the upstairs part to try some whiskey. It was pricey (for a student), but had a great atmosphere, food and, of course, whiskey. The bartender was knowledgeable and helpful: overall, a fantastic experience.
Stunning.  Room was immaculate, clean (which is not always the case) and well appointed.  Awesome view from our room.  Perfect place to spend our wedding night.  Thanks guys.

Our room was well appointed and comfortable. Off street parking was a plus. Great service by all staff. Being next to the beach and a great selection places to eat made our stay all the better. Would recommend in a heartbeat.
Awesome spot. Nice views. Great neighbourhood. Nearby surf beach.
It's a very good place and beautiful ocean view and you can have a long beach walk
Lovely place, lovely view, friendly staff. Shower was too small, water flowed out of the shower unit, apart from that it was lovely
